frame_feature_extractor module¶

Date

2022-02-28

Author

Quin Adam

Description

This module was created for feature extraction from videos. It is designed to take in a frame, and return the skeletons of the people in the frame. The skeletons map out both joints and bones, and are used as features for machine learning.

frame_feature_extractor.combine_feature(joints, bones)¶

Combines the features from joints and bones into one feature tensor for ML training and inference.

Parameters

  • joints ([1, 6, 13, 3] tensor) – a tensor with the locations of the joints of each skeleton

  • bones ([1, 6, 14, 2] tensor) – a tensor with the angle and length of each bone

Returns

a tensor with these features combined into one feature tensor, [1, 6, (13*3)+(14*2)=67]

Return type

[1, 6, 67] tensor

frame_feature_extractor.create_bone_feature(joints)¶

Uses joints to create features from their connections (bones)

Parameters

joints ([1, 6, 13, 3] tensor) – a tensor with the locations of the joints of each skeleton

Returns

a tensor with the angle and length of each bone

Return type

[1, 6, 14, 2] tensor

frame_feature_extractor.downsize_frame(frame, target_size=256)¶

Downsizes an image to the target_size on its longest axis.

Parameters

  • frame ([1, h, w, c] image) – a [1, h, w, c] image, h: height, w: width, c: channel (RGB)

  • target_size (int) – a target length for the long side of the image

Returns

an image tensor who’s longest size is target size

Return type

[1, h, w, c] tensor

frame_feature_extractor.get_features_from_image(frame)¶

Takes in an image of any size and extracts the skeletal features of that image.

Parameters

frame ([1, h, w, c] image) – a [1, h, w, c] image, h: height, w: width, c: channel (RGB)

Returns

a tensor with the extracted features

Return type

[1, 6, 17, 3] tensor

frame_feature_extractor.movenet(scaled_frame_tensor)¶

Takes an image and returns the joints of skeletons in the image. The longest side of the image must be 256 pixels.

Parameters

scaled_frame_tensor ([1, h, w, c] tensor) – a [1, h, w, c] image who’s longest side is 256 pixels, h: height, w: width, c: channel (RGB)

Returns

a [1, 6, 56] ndarray, the second dimension is for each skeleton, the third dimension has multiple parts: the first 17*3=51 floats are (y, x, confidence-score) of each of the 17 joints, the last 5 are (y-min, x-min, y-max, x-max, confidence-score) of the bounding box around the skeleton

Return type

[1, 6, 56] ndarray

frame_feature_extractor.remove_unusable_joints(joints)¶

Creates a mask of joints with a low confidence score. Also combines the 5 joints on the head into just one.

Parameters

joints ([1, 6, 17, 3] tensor) – a tensor with the locations of the joints of each skeleton

Returns

joints: the same input joints tensor with the head joints combined, joint_mask: a mask for the joints based on the confidence score of them

Return type

([1, 6, 13, 3] tensor, [1, 6, 13] tensor)

frame_feature_extractor.reorganize_movenet_result(movenet_result)¶

Changes raw movenet data to a more usable format. Specifically it puts joints and bounding box in their own tensors. Also returns a mask of which skeletons are viable based on the bounding box confidence score.

Parameters

movenet_result ([1, 6, 56] ndarray) – an ndarray containing the result from the movenet interpreter

Returns

joints: a tensor with the locations of the joints of each skeleton, boxes: a tensor with the bounds of each skeleton, people_mask: a mask of which skeletons are actually detected

Return type

([1, 6, 17, 3] tensor, [1, 6, 4] tensor, [1, 6, 1] tensor)
